name: recultivation, shale quarry | recultivation, shale quarry | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/11360/documentation

The dataset represents the recultivation of a shale quarry. Rough estimate extrapolated fom recultivation, limestone mine dataset (ecoinvent v3). ;If possible, this dataset should be improved with more specific information.;;Comment taken from recultivation, limestone mine dataset (ecoinvent v3) : ;The ratio of topsoil (assumed density: 1'400 kg/m3, thickness: 0.3 m, weight: 420 kg/m2, ) to extracted limestone (density: 2'300 kg/m3, thickness: 70m, weight: 160'000 kg/m2) is about 0.26%. The diesel fuel used for covering the closed mine is thus calculated using this ratio compared to its requirement during operation of the mine.



Includes only transformation from mineral extraction site to forest and the diesel consumption.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/39:Remediation activities and other waste management services/390:Remediation activities and other waste management services/3900:Remediation activities and other waste management services

processDocumentation.timeDescription: dataset based on approximation only, therefore data entry si the reference year
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: data are only from one company in Switzerland (KFN)
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Extrapolated from a medium size Swiss limesonte mine, with a topsoil thickness 30 cm.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH, for recultivation, limestone mine (2000-2002). The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
